p: In general, Gram-positive bacteria were the most sensitive to the effects of essential oil (EO), and this may be related to the fact that Gram-positive bacteria are more susceptible to the effects of volatile components compared to the Gram-negative ones [ 48]. In the case of fungi, EOs can be a viable alternative in the fight against the infection caused by Candida [ 24, 49]. These biological effects can be related to the presence of chemically active compounds such as γ-elemene, curzerene, germacrene D, β-elemenone, and atractylon, as there are reports in the literature that corroborate this thesis [ 50, 51, 52].
